android.smartcard
Interface ITerminal

All Known Implementing Classes:
SmartMxTerminal, Terminal, UiccTerminal
public interface ITerminal

Smartcard service interface for terminal resources.

Method Summary
 void closeChannels()
          Closes all open channels of this terminal.
 IChannel getChannel(long hChannel)
          Returns the channel for the specified handle or null if this handle is not registered.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Returns the reader name.
 boolean isCardPresent()
          Returns true if a card is present; false otherwise.
 long openBasicChannel(byte[] aid, android.smartcard.ISmartcardServiceCallback callback)
          Opens the basic channel to the card.

          Opens the basic channel to the card.
 long openLogicalChannel(byte[] aid, android.smartcard.ISmartcardServiceCallback callback)
          Opens a logical channel to the card.

          Opens a logical channel to the card.

          Sends a select command on the basic channel.

          Sends a select command on the basic channel.
 

Method Detail

closeChannels

void closeChannels()
Closes all open channels of this terminal.

getChannel

IChannel getChannel(long hChannel)
Returns the channel for the specified handle or null if this handle is not registered.

Parameters:
hChannel - the channel handle.
Returns:
the channel for the specified handle or null if this handle is not registered.

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the reader name.

Returns:
the reader name.

select

void select()
Sends a select command on the basic channel. With this command the default application will be selected on the card. (e.g. CardManager)

select

void select(byte[] aid)
Sends a select command on the basic channel.

Parameters:
aid - the aid which should be selected

openBasicChannel

long openBasicChannel(android.smartcard.ISmartcardServiceCallback callback)
                      throws CardException
Opens the basic channel to the card.

Parameters:
callback - the callback used to react on the death of the client.
Returns:
a handle for the basic channel.
Throws:
CardException - if opening the basic channel failed or the basic channel is in use.

openBasicChannel

long openBasicChannel(byte[] aid,
                      android.smartcard.ISmartcardServiceCallback callback)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Opens the basic channel to the card.

Parameters:
aid - the AID of the applet to be selected.
callback - the callback used to react on the death of the client.
Returns:
a handle for the basic channel.
Throws:
CardException - if opening the basic channel failed or the basic channel is in use.
java.lang.Exception

isCardPresent

boolean isCardPresent()
                      throws CardException
Returns true if a card is present; false otherwise.

Returns:
true if a card is present; false otherwise.
Throws:
CardException - if card presence information is not available.
